I am currently a fourth-year PhD student in Public Policy at the Goldman School of Public Policy at UC Berkeley. I am interested in learning about how we can increase access to opportunity for all children, particularly those from disadvantaged and historically marginalized backgrounds.
My research, broadly, examines how public policy and political institutions can work to perpetuate or attenuate economic and racial inequality, with recent work focusing on voting rights, land use regulations, and low-income housing policy. This works sits at the intersection of (local) public finance, urban economics, and political economy.
Prior to coming to UC Berkeley, I conducted research on a range of issues affecting low-income families at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities.

summary: In this project, I study land use liberalization in a major American city. I examine the effects of the reform on housing construction and affordability. I also study the consequences of the reform for economic and racial integration. I aim to develop a neighborhood choice model to study how relaxing land use regulations affects the ability of lower-income households to live in higher opportunity neighborhoods.
title: The Effects of Land Use Reform on Housing Supply, Segregation, and Neighborhood Choice

R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
You can embed an R code chunk like this:
summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.:19.0 3rd Qu.: 56.00 ## Max. :25.0 Max. :120.00 fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars) fit ## ## Call: ## lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars) ## ## Coefficients: ## (Intercept) speed ## -17.579 3.932 Including Plots You can also embed plots. See Figure 1 for example:
par(mar = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) pie( c(280, 60, 20), c('Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid'), col = c('#0292D8', '#F7EA39', '#C4B632'), init.angle = -50, border = NA ) Figure 1: A fancy pie chart.
